message_1: Suppose you want to encrypt the message "HELLO WORLD" using a rail fence cipher with a rail key of 3. What will be the encrypted message?
message_2:
A rail fence cipher works by writing the message in a zigzag pattern along a set number of rails (in this case, 3 rails) and then reading the message off row by row. Here's how the message "HELLO WORLD" would be written using a rail fence cipher with a rail key of 3:

H . . . O . . . R . . .
. E . L . W . L . D .
. . L . . . O . . . .

Now, read the message off row by row:

HOLEWDLOR

The encrypted message using a rail fence cipher with a rail key of 3 is "HOLEWDLOR".
